content:
• Tuesday, November 1, 2011

  • Risk markets shed a bit more in evening trade after Bloomberg reports Papandreou as saying...

    Risk markets shed a bit more in evening trade after Bloomberg reports Papandreou as saying Greece's euro membership will be part of the referendum put to the nation's citizens (rather than just the question of accepting the latest bailout). The euro dives 60 pips to $1.3640. S&P futures -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 PM | 16 Comments
  • WMB

    More on Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB): Q3 swung to a profit absent some big prior-year restructuring...

    More on Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB): Q3 swung to a profit absent some big prior-year restructuring charges and the write-off on the sale of some of the company's assets in the Texas Barnett Shale region. Net profit increased 27% Y/Y on wider margins from the company's natural-gas liquids business, higher midstream fees and improved results in its gas pipeline business. Shares +2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM
  • CVLT

    Storage software vendor CommVault (CVLT +5.2%) rose strongly post-earnings for the second...

    Storage software vendor CommVault (CVLT +5.2%) rose strongly post-earnings for the second straight quarter. FQ2 revenue of $97.5M (+30% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.24 beat consensus by $4.5M and $0.03, and the company's deferred revenue balance grew 4% Q/Q, to $107M. Rival Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC) saw just 9% growth last quarter for its Storage & Server Management division. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU) is now up 5% AH following its FQ1 report. While JDS says Thai flooding will...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU) is now up 5% AH following its FQ1 report. While JDS says Thai flooding will have a $35M-$45M impact on FQ2 sales, its FQ2 revenue guidance range of $375M-$405M ($415.1M consensus) is better than some investors feared. Other optical component names are also rising: FNSR +3.2%. OPXT +6.2%. OCLR +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • OPEN

    More on OpenTable's Q3: 40% Y/Y revenue growth represents a slowdown from Q2's 53%. Subscription...

    More on OpenTable's Q3: 40% Y/Y revenue growth represents a slowdown from Q2's 53%. Subscription revenue up slightly Q/Q, but reservation revenue down by similar amount. North American restaurant base grew 4% Q/Q to 16.2K, but seated diners declined by 400K, to 21.8M. North America 85% of revenue, international markets 15%. OPEN -11.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • RLOC

    Shares of ReachLocal (NASDAQ:RLOC) fall 10% AH despite turning an unexpected Q3 profit,...

    Shares of ReachLocal (NASDAQ:RLOC) fall 10% AH despite turning an unexpected Q3 profit, reporting EPS of $0.09 vs. -$0.05 consensus. The online marketing company says a "challenging macroeconomic environment" will keep revenue in the near-term relatively flat.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) drops 7.2% AH after announcing its $2.35B acquisition of Procter...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) drops 7.2% AH after announcing its $2.35B acquisition of Procter & Gamble's (NYSE:PG) Pringles business, previously expected to close in December, is now expected to close in 1H 2012. The closing date was revised to make time for Diamond's audit committee to investigate the company's "accounting for certain crop payments to walnut growers."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • CGNX

    Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX) Q3 beats expectations as revenue rose 7% Y/Y, with solid sales growth out...

    Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX) Q3 beats expectations as revenue rose 7% Y/Y, with solid sales growth out of the Americas, China and Europe. Gross margin also rose slightly to 76%. The company lowers FY11 guidance however, on projected weakness in its semiconductor and electronics businesses. For Q4, revenue is seen between $80M - $83M , below expectations of $85M. Separately, the company said it approved a stock buyback plan for up to $80 million in shares. Shares -7.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q3 EPS of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $34M (+40% Y/Y) misses by $2M....

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q3 EPS of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $34M (+40% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares -8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • IBM

    Kenexa (KNXA), a provider of cloud HR software, gains 2.4% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of...

    Kenexa (KNXA), a provider of cloud HR software, gains 2.4% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $77.2M (+52% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.23, beating consensus by $3.5M and $0.03. The company's deferred revenue balance grew 2.8% Q/Q, to $87.3M. Kenexa expects Q4 revenue of $76M-$78M and EPS of $0.25-$0.26, compared with a consensus of $74.7M and $0.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • ALLT

    Allot Communications (NASDAQ:ALLT) opened to a modest gain following its Q3 report, but closed...

    Allot Communications (NASDAQ:ALLT) opened to a modest gain following its Q3 report, but closed up 8.1%. Revenue of $20.1M (+37% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.13 beat consensus by $1.4M and $0.03, and the supplier of deep packet inspection networking gear added it received orders from 9 large service providers during the quarter, 5 of whom were new customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • AKRX

    Specialty pharmaceutical firm Akorn (NASDAQ:AKRX) finishes the day up over 10% after its Q3...

    Specialty pharmaceutical firm Akorn (NASDAQ:AKRX) finishes the day up over 10% after its Q3 easily beats estimates. Revenue jumped 69% Y/Y on higher sales and the continued growth of its injectable and ophthalmic products launched in 2010. Gross margin rose to 60% due to a favorable product mix, price increases and more efficient plant utilization.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • MRVL

    Network processor maker Cavium (CAVM +2.9%) is one of the day's rare gainers after reporting Q3...

    Network processor maker Cavium (CAVM +2.9%) is one of the day's rare gainers after reporting Q3 results, including lower Q4 guidance. But Rodman & Renshaw raises its rating on the stock to Outperform from Market Perform, believing CAVM’s chips for wireless base station equipment should benefit from the wave of upgrades to LTE cellular networks.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • RDC

    Rowan (RDC -6.51%) falls after its Q3 earnings report misses Street consensus. Revenue was...

    Rowan (RDC -6.51%) falls after its Q3 earnings report misses Street consensus. Revenue was negatively impacted by reduced rig utilization due to the effects of rig moves, as well as higher repair and maintenance expenses. Drilling margins also declined to 45% from 55% due to the relocations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CME

    CME Group (CME -7.2%) shares sink despite a 29% jump in Q3 earnings, as the exchange operator...

    CME Group (CME -7.2%) shares sink despite a 29% jump in Q3 earnings, as the exchange operator booked bigger clearing and transaction fee revenue and significantly improved margins. But the demise of MF Global, previously one of CME's busiest members, is pressuring the stock. It isn't clear that CME will bear any exposure, but the uncertainty surely is a distraction.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +3.5%) trades higher after Deutsche initiates the shares with...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +3.5%) trades higher after Deutsche initiates the shares with a Buy, saying the company has a couple of drugs in its pipeline that could be lucrative, with a risk/reward ratio that presents an investment opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • F

    Ford (F -4.8%) and General Motors (GM -8.7%) are in the investor doghouse after sales rose less...

    Ford (F -4.8%) and General Motors (GM -8.7%) are in the investor doghouse after sales rose less than expected in October. Ford posted a 6.2% bump, below forecasts, although strong SUV sales offer hope for near-term margin improvement. GM sales inched forward; inventory rose to 82 days' supply, up from 67 days in September.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 3 Comments
  • VICL

    Shares of Vical (VICL +2.7%) buck the downtrend after its Q3 results blew out estimates. Revenue...

    Shares of Vical (VICL +2.7%) buck the downtrend after its Q3 results blew out estimates. Revenue soared tenfold due to a surge in licensing revenue from its TransVax vaccine, which is designed to control cytomegalovirus reactivation in transplant recipients.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • GILD

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +10.7%) jumps after announcing earlier it's initiated Phase 3 studies for...

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +10.7%) jumps after announcing earlier it's initiated Phase 3 studies for its hepatitis C virus nucleotide analog, PSI-7977.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • RHP

    Shares of Gaylord Entertainment (GET -11.8%) take a hit after the firm reports...

    Shares of Gaylord Entertainment (GET -11.8%) take a hit after the firm reports worse-than-expected Q3 earnings and issues lukewarm guidance for Q4. The hospitality and attractions company pins the blame for the earnings miss on a decrease in outside-the-room spending and underperformance in its Washington DC property.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -7.7%) is among the hardest-hit Euro tech names, thanks to downgrades from...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -7.7%) is among the hardest-hit Euro tech names, thanks to downgrades from JPMorgan and MKM Partners. JPMorgan is worried about the profits lost by the recent sale of Alcatel's call-center software business, and echoes Jefferies' concerns about declining EV-DO equipment sales. MKM, meanwhile, thinks T and VZ's weak capex is a problem.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • VSH

    Vishay Intertechnology (VSH -6.9%) trades down after its Q3 misses on all counts. Net revenue...

    Vishay Intertechnology (VSH -6.9%) trades down after its Q3 misses on all counts. Net revenue rose +16% Y/Y, but was below analysts' expectations due to a continuing slowdown in its European markets. Q/Q net revenue declined 3.4%, with particular weakness coming from its Foil Technology Products and Weighing Modules and Control Systems units.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • THC

    Tenet Healthcare's (THC +2%) Q3 topped estimates due to a late-quarter boost to the hospital...

    Tenet Healthcare's (THC +2%) Q3 topped estimates due to a late-quarter boost to the hospital operators outpatient visits. Surgeries and admissions also rose marginally, and the company says these trends are likely to continue through the end of FY11. Earnings dipped Y/Y however, due primarily to a large tax benefit the previous year. The company reaffirms its FY11 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -10.3%), a Chinese web browser and anti-virus software provider, gets clobbered...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -10.3%), a Chinese web browser and anti-virus software provider, gets clobbered after Citron Research sets a $5 PT. Citron claims Qihoo's reach among Chinese web users is nowhere as broad as its claims would indicate, and that CEO Zhou Hongyi's track record suggests he can't be trusted.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +4.2%) trades up as its FQ1 earnings missed analysts' revenue...

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +4.2%) trades up as its FQ1 earnings missed analysts' revenue expectations, but beat on a per share basis. The for-profit educator also projects FQ2 revenue to come in above consensus. It now sees an EPS of around breakeven - $0.02 per share on revenue of between $412M - $422M, Above Street expectations of $403M in revenue on a breakeven EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CSCO

    MKM Partners' Michael Genovese initiates coverage of Cisco (CSCO -4.2%) with a Buy rating and...

    MKM Partners' Michael Genovese initiates coverage of Cisco (CSCO -4.2%) with a Buy rating and $25 target price, the latest in a recent string of positive research notes (I, II), as "recently lowered multi-year forecasts appear reasonable and attractive." The stock trades at 10.2x 2012 estimated profit, vs. S&P's 11.4x.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • CRK

    Comstock Resources (CRK -8.6%) takes a hit after its Q3 results miss net sales estimates due to...

    Comstock Resources (CRK -8.6%) takes a hit after its Q3 results miss net sales estimates due to lower natural gas prices. Additionally, the company lowers its growth estimates for 2012. Stifel Nicolaus cut the stock to hold on the back of the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (GEOY -14.5%) dives after reporting Q3 revenue of $85.8M (-1% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.51,...

    GeoEye (GEOY -14.5%) dives after reporting Q3 revenue of $85.8M (-1% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.51, missing consensus by $7.2M and $0.05. In addition, the company now expects 2011 revenue of $348M-$355M and EPS of $1.95-$2.15, below a consensus of $369.6M and $2.19. Rival satellite imagery firm DigitalGlobe (DGI -9.2%) is also off sharply.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -7.2%) sells off after receiving bullish coverage from Gabelli, and...

    Universal Display (PANL -7.2%) sells off after receiving bullish coverage from Gabelli, and bearish coverage from Piper. Gabelli sees the company's OLED materials sales soaring thanks to growing tablet and TV use, while Piper is skeptical about near-term TV adoption, and concerned about Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) unwillingness to use OLED displays.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • CHTR

    Like peers TWC and CVC (I, II), cable provider Charter (CHTR +1.8%) bled video subscribers in...

    Like peers TWC and CVC (I, II), cable provider Charter (CHTR +1.8%) bled video subscribers in Q3: the company's Q3 report showed it lost 64.8K video subs, following a 79.9K decline in Q2. However, unlike its peers, Charter is moving higher post-earnings, as investors focus on its net gain of 156K broadband subs, well above Q2's 18.5K gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • BGC

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC) continues to plunge, now down over 22%, after a disapointing Q3 report...

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC) continues to plunge, now down over 22%, after a disapointing Q3 report yesterday where it missed analysts' estimates due to poor FX execution and lowered its Q4 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • HW

    Building products supplier Headwaters (HW -4%) trades down after its FQ4 earnings missed...

    Building products supplier Headwaters (HW -4%) trades down after its FQ4 earnings missed analysts' expectations due to ongoing weakness in the residential housing market. Restructuring costs in its light building products segment also weighed on its bottom-line, as the company struggles to find a buyer for its discontinued coal cleaning business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • DTG

    Shares of Dollar Thrifty (NYSE:DTG) trade down 2.6% after the firm reports Q3 results that beat...

    Shares of Dollar Thrifty (NYSE:DTG) trade down 2.6% after the firm reports Q3 results that beat estimates off of strong rental revenue. CEO Scott Thompson says that even with a pricing headwind, the firm benefited from a favorable used vehicle market and low-cost operating structure. The company sees rental revenue increasing 1%-2% in Q4, offsetting a decline in revenue per day. Rivals Hertz (HTZ -6.6%) and Avis Budget (CAR -8.5%) are showing steeper declines on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • HSIC

    Henry Schein (HSIC -7.4%) beat Q3 estimates, but earnings climbed less-than-expected as the...

    Henry Schein (HSIC -7.4%) beat Q3 estimates, but earnings climbed less-than-expected as the vaccine maker suffered from lower sales of its flu shots and margin pressure due to higher costs. The company also issues cautious guidance for FY12, citing foreign currency concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • AABA

    How is it that Yahoo (YHOO -5.5%), which supposedly want to sell itself, winds up buying another...

    How is it that Yahoo (YHOO -5.5%), which supposedly want to sell itself, winds up buying another company? All Things D's Peter Kafka thinks the purchase of Interclick (ICLK +21%) makes sense because it brings new talent and technology: "Whoever does end up with Yahoo will want an ad business that’s not spiraling into a hole, so if this helps [YHOO] pull that off, it will be money well-spent."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • GEL

    Genesis Energy (GEL -1.4%) acquires varied interests in three Gulf of Mexico crude-oil pipeline...

    Genesis Energy (GEL -1.4%) acquires varied interests in three Gulf of Mexico crude-oil pipeline systems from Marathon Oil (MRO -5.2%) for $205M, including an estimated $29M of crude oil at current market rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • T

    While Leap Wireless (LEAP +11.9%) is soaring thanks to its Q3 report, the opposite is true for...

    While Leap Wireless (LEAP +11.9%) is soaring thanks to its Q3 report, the opposite is true for rival discount carrier MetroPCS (PCS -6.8%). In addition to missing EPS estimates, MetroPCS reported net subscriber additions of just 69K, far below Q2's 200K. Moreover, churn increased by 60 bps, to 4.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • AU

    Shares of South African miners dip on gold weakness today: AngloGold (AU -1.4%), Gold Fields...

    Shares of South African miners dip on gold weakness today: AngloGold (AU -1.4%), Gold Fields (GFI -2.8%), Harmony Gold (HMY -2.8%) and Randgold Resources (RAND -2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • SHOO

    Shares of Steven Madden (NASDAQ:SHOO) knock out a 3.2% gain after beating Q3 EPS estimates by...

    Shares of Steven Madden (NASDAQ:SHOO) knock out a 3.2% gain after beating Q3 EPS estimates by $0.04 on revenue of $314M (+71% Y/Y) and raising its outlook for FY11. The company now sees EPS in a range of $2.20-$2.25, higher than its prior guidance of $2.15-$2.20.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • TRMD-OLD

    Danish shipping company Torm A/S (TRMD-OLD -11.2%) gets slammed after the company warns - for a...

    Danish shipping company Torm A/S (TRMD-OLD -11.2%) gets slammed after the company warns - for a second time - that its FY11 results will be lower than expected due to pressure on freight rates and continued global economic uncertainty. The shipper now expects to lose around $175M - $195M, compared to earlier guidance of a loss between $100M - $175M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • CCO

    Billboard advertising provider Clear Channel Outdoor (NYSE:CCO) is down 9.6% after reporting Q3...

    Billboard advertising provider Clear Channel Outdoor (NYSE:CCO) is down 9.6% after reporting Q3 revenue of $748.4M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.01. The former beat by $18.4M, but the latter missed by $0.04, as the 8% operating expense growth for the company's Americas division easily outpaced the division's 4% revenue growth. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (MT -4.5%), Europe's largest steelmaker, takes a hit after Moody's downgrades its...

    ArcelorMittal (MT -4.5%), Europe's largest steelmaker, takes a hit after Moody's downgrades its outlook for the European steel industry to negative from stable due to concerns that a global economic slowdown and the European debt crisis may cause steel demand to shrink over the next 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA -4%) shares sag under the weight of two negative notes. Canaccord's Bobby Burleson...

    Nvidia (NVDA -4%) shares sag under the weight of two negative notes. Canaccord's Bobby Burleson cuts his rating to Hold from Buy and his price target to $15 from $18, warning the company may be making too many of its Tegra processors for a weaker-than-expected market for non-Apple smartphones and tablets. Evercore's Patrick Wang also fears Tegra growth may disappoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • ASIA

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -21.6%) gets crushed after posting its Q3 report. While revenue of $119M...

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -21.6%) gets crushed after posting its Q3 report. While revenue of $119M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.37 beat consensus by $1.9M and $0.01, the company expects Q4 EPS of just $0.30-$0.33, well below a $0.42 consensus. The weak Q4 guidance suggests AsiaInfo's operating margin, already getting hit by higher R&D spending, will see further compression.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • WINN

    Winn-Dixie Stores (WINN +6.8%) pops after its FQ1 loss narrowed on another quarter of same-store...

    Winn-Dixie Stores (WINN +6.8%) pops after its FQ1 loss narrowed on another quarter of same-store sales growth. The company also managed to expand its profit margin by cutting expenses, despite continued food cost inflation. Overall net sales increased 3.1% to $1.6B, as same-store sales rose 3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM

  • With 2 hours before the close, European shares have halted their freefall and bounced hard, with...

    With 2 hours before the close, European shares have halted their freefall and bounced hard, with most of the indices about 2-3% off of their lows. Stoxx 50 -4.3%, Germany -3.7%, Italy -5.6%, U.K. -2.3%. The euro is recovering as well, -1% at $1.37. American stocks following suit, the S&P 500 down just 1.8%. Plum out of rumors as far as rescues go, could the float of an ECB rate cut be far off?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • RDN

    Radian (RDN +20.1%) soars after reporting Q3 profits increased 64% Y/Y as the mortgage insurer...

    Radian (RDN +20.1%) soars after reporting Q3 profits increased 64% Y/Y as the mortgage insurer realizes benefits tied to fewer delinquencies and sees an increase in new mortgage insurance written. The company expects Q4 mortgage insurance claims paid to push the full-year total to $1.6B - before claims fall off to $1.3B in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • ROG

    Shares of Rogers (NYSE:ROG) decline 12% after the company misses Q3 revenue estimates, reporting...

    Shares of Rogers (NYSE:ROG) decline 12% after the company misses Q3 revenue estimates, reporting $147.6M vs. $148.4M consensus. CEO Bruce Hoechner warns the company sees "significant" slowing in demand for wireless infrastructure, and forecasts the mass transit, solar, and wind turbine markets will show weakness for the next six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (FST -9.2%) is following other oil producers lower (IEO -8.2%) after reporting Q3...

    Forest Oil (FST -9.2%) is following other oil producers lower (IEO -8.2%) after reporting Q3 revenue of $174.1M (-1% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.25; the latter was in-line, but the former missed by $23.5M. The company expects its oil and gas to grow by 4%-7% Q/Q in 2011. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA -6.6%) CFO James Bell will retire April 1, to be succeeded by Controller Greg Smith....

    Boeing (BA -6.6%) CFO James Bell will retire April 1, to be succeeded by Controller Greg Smith. Bell has been finance chief since 2003 and was interim CEO before the appointment of Jim McNerney. "This should be a trouble-free transition," an RBC analyst says. "It also marks another step in the generational hand-over at Boeing."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • AA

    Shares of Alcoa (AA -3.5%) rebound after being down over 7% on the open after taking on a...

    Shares of Alcoa (AA -3.5%) rebound after being down over 7% on the open after taking on a Greece-China double punch to the guts. Adding to the mix, the company is also linked to a bribery scandal involving British investor Victor Dahdaleh.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • TRNX

    Medical device manufacturer Tornier (TRNX -8%) trades down after JP Morgan cuts the stock to...

    Medical device manufacturer Tornier (TRNX -8%) trades down after JP Morgan cuts the stock to Neutral on valuation. The firm says that although it still believes in the company's long-term strategy, it prefers to move to the sidelines to see how the next few quarters "shake out."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • IVAC

    Intervac (NASDAQ:IVAC), which recently surged on the belief that Thai flooding would boost...

    Intervac (NASDAQ:IVAC), which recently surged on the belief that Thai flooding would boost demand for its hard drive manufacturing equipment, is down 11.2% after reporting Q3 revenue of $19.3M (-70% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.27, beating consensus by $1.9M and $0.01. The company's order backlog fell 29% Q/Q, to $26.2M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • LVS

    The Macau Gaming Board estimates the territory's gambling revenue grew 42% Y/Y in October, to...

    The Macau Gaming Board estimates the territory's gambling revenue grew 42% Y/Y in October, to roughly $3.4B. However, the news isn't doing much to help Macau casino owners, who are selling off in tandem with other high-beta, recession-vulnerable names: LVS -3.3%. MGM -7.2%. [[WYNN] -5.5%. MPEL -9.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • MSTR

    Business intelligence software vendor MicroStrategy (MSTR -9.8%) falls hard after reporting Q3...

    Business intelligence software vendor MicroStrategy (MSTR -9.8%) falls hard after reporting Q3 revenue of $141.7M (+24% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.44; while the latter beat by $.02, the former was merely in-line, and an in-line number can be problematic for a company with a trailing P/E above 50. In addition, MicroStrategy's deferred revenue balance fell 5% Q/Q, to $97.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM

  • Usually a safe haven on days like this, even gold isn't escaping the general panic as the rising...

    Usually a safe haven on days like this, even gold isn't escaping the general panic as the rising dollar sends futures -2.1% to $1688.90/oz. However, silver is taking a much greater hit, sinking 6.1% to $32.244. The metal is "very much as an industrial metal right now," says one trader. Copper -4.4% to $3.473 and Platinum -2.7% to 1563.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • MFGLQ

    Still trying to distance itself from MF Global (MF), Jefferies (JEF -19.7%) issues a statement...

    Still trying to distance itself from MF Global (MF), Jefferies (JEF -19.7%) issues a statement saying it "has no meaningful exposure to the sovereign debt of the PIIGS," nor does it have "any repo-to-maturity actiity or related off balance-sheet derivative activity."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) falls 5.3% after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $129.1M...

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) falls 5.3% after reporting Q3 results.
